fields.description: create alarms from scaling group detail page
fields.summary: Create alarms from scaling group details page

comments.body: Uppercase option group sections when working on this.

[~jloza]: This ticket is almost ready for review, but I'm running into the following issues...

1. Only Firefox seems to allow the option group labels to be styled.  Let me know if you'd like those styled anyway -- although it seems odd to only have the styles applied in one browser, so I'd vote to not modify those styles.

2. Due to the way we're building the metric options via Angular's ng-options, we're stuck with either *always* displaying the metrics grouped by namespace, or not grouping them at all.  Note that custom metrics have custom namespaces, so I'd vote we always show the metrics grouped by the namespace label.  If a customer creates two custom metrics with the same name but in different namespaces, not showing the namespace would display the "same" custom metrics twice if we don't always display the namespace label, and grouping the metrics by the namespace label would remove that confusion.  See the two screenshots I attached to this ticket to understand what I'm getting at.

hi [~kgill] I use Chrome and the CF labels were styled in Chrome. (gray rather than black, I assume the uppercase isn't a problem)

I don't understand what you are getting at with your second question and the screenshots aren't helping. Why would we not show the grouping labels? We definitely should, and the custom ones should be in their own group like you show in the screenshots. What's the question here?

[~jloza]: That's Chrome styling the metric groups gray, and we have no control over that other than in Firefox.

For question #2, I was asking if we could *always* show the grouping, which goes against what I mentioned during our 1:1 where I mentioned (or asked?) if we'd only show the groupings on the ASG monitoring page when the ASG has an ELB.  Sounds as though we're on the same page w.r.t. grouping the metrics, so I'll leave those in place.

[~jloza]: BTW, if we opt to always show the metrics grouped by namespace labels, we'll probably need to update the Create Alarm dialog wireframe as only the ASG metrics display the groupings (when an ASG has an ELB), right?

ah, I get what you are asking now, [~kgill]. Can you check with the team about hiding the groupings on other pages? They are just noise there, and I know [~ashamblin] was able to hide items from the list in other spots (some volume metrics associated with provisioned IOPS that we don't support). I bet y'all can find a way!

[~jloza]: I pushed a commit (https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/6b95805484cb76ee546) that handles not displaying the namespace label grouping for metrics when only a single namespace (i.e. no custom metrics or no ASG with ELB) covers all metrics in the list.  That, combined with the ng-if conditions, seems to handle the conditional display of metrics by namespace label groups fairly well.  [~ashamblin]: Since you have changes to create-alarm.js in flight (for GUI-2199), could you review that commit and lemme know if my changes will cause trouble and/or merge conflicts for your work in progress?

Ready for UX review.

PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1897

almost there! Two minor things:

* headers in metric dropdown should be uppercase plz
* scaling group you launch this from should be default selection in alarm action editor, select scaling group dropdown
* This dialog should also be used when launching from the scaling group policy creation workflow. By far the most common use cases for scaling group alarms are for the instance and elb metrics, the others are outliers and we can greatly simplify the experience for the majority of users by using this dialog in both places, and allowing users to set the less common scaling actions from resources outside the scaling group from the resource detail pages now. 

Great job! Thanks!

[~jloza]: Fix uppercase headers in metrics section.

For defaulting to the current scaling group, there doesn't seem a way to set that based on how the alarm actions editor is currently implemented.  We may need to convert the alarm actions editor panel to an Angular directive, unless [~ashamblin] has other ideas?

Converting the old create alarm dialog to the new one on the scaling group create policy page is a significant amount of work.  Should we perhaps move that to a separate ticket to avoid holding this one up?
[~kgill], just like the create alarm dialog had been, the alarm actions editor panel simply wraps up a directive.  We don't have to use the panel.

[~kgill] let's see if you can ge the work all done in this ticket first, if it's taking too long we can open another ticket but it's really just more administrivia since at this point it's all gotta get done in this sprint for feature complete.
[~jloza]: I've addressed the remaining issues AFAICT... back to you for review

hi [~kgill], so close! All the issues are addressed expect for one thing:

When the create alarm dialog is launched from the scaling group policy page, the actions section should be hidden, since you are in the middle of the workflow for creating the action when you create the alarm. :) It's just a simple create alarm at that point. 

Thanks!
Hiding the alarm actions editor in the create alarm dialog on the create scaling policy page will be handled in GUI-2199 to avoid painful merge conflicts in create-alarm.js
UX review passed, ready for code review! Great teamwork, guys!

[~jloza]: I pulled this out of QA since I discovered an issue w.r.t. the dimensions in the create alarm dialog on the create scaling policy page (screenshot attached).  The dialog defaults to the ASG dimensions, which are fine when a scaling group doesn't have an ELB.  However, when an ELB is present the dimensions should be set to the ASG only when an EC2 metric is selected (e.g. CPUUtilization for all instances in the ASG).  If the ASG has an ELB and an ELB metric is selected, the alarm (and scaling policy) will fail as the ASG dimension is incorrect.  We ran into this issue in GUI-2126 (fixed in 4.2 in the old create alarm dialog), and it will resurface unless we handle this better in the new create alarm dialog.

[~jloza]: OK, I think I fixed the broken namespace and dimensions issues in the create alarm dialog for an ASG with an ELB when launched from the scaling group monitoring or create scaling policy page, preventing GUI-2126 from resurfacing AFAICT.  I also fixed the requirement to hide the alarm actions editor in the dialog on the create scaling policy page.  Submitting this for UX review again... please confirm in the GUI-2199 branch.
Looks good! Code review and merge please.
merged a few days ago.
[~dkavanagh]: Latest changes for GUI-2409 are in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1889
